Class LaunchPadMini

  • java.lang.Object
    • LaunchPadMini

  • public class LaunchPadMini
extends java.lang.Object
    A wrapper for the MIDI controller Novation LaunchPad Mini.
    The most trivial application of this wrapper is to adjust and control your Processing sketch using the pads of the controller, by attaching pads to variables. The easiest way to attach a Knob to a variable is to use Knob.variable(String variableName, inside Processing `setup()` method: Alternatively, you can also use the following events (*) to track changes to knobs and pads:

    void launchControllerChanged() is triggered when either a knob or a pad has changed. This event does not provide additional information of which knob or pad has changed.

    void launchControllerKnobChanged(KNOBS knob) is trigger when a knob has changed. The parameter knob will have the value of which knob was changed.

    TWO_PI + HALF_PI * .void launchControllerPadChanged(PADS pad) is triggered when a pad has switched states. The parameter pad will have the value of which pad was changed.
    (*) In Processing, simply add a new method with the names and parameters as above.

      • getPad

        public boolean getPad(int ix)
        The status of a given pad as a boolean value. Alternative, you can get the status of a pad a int value with getPadInt(int)
        Returns:
        True if the pad is "on", False otherwise.

      • getPadInt

        public int getPadInt(int ix)
        The status of a given pad as int value.
        Parameters:
        ix - The index of the pad to check.
        Returns:
        1 if the pad is on, 0 otherwise.

        public void setControlColor(byte controlIx,
                            LED_COLOR color)
        This command sets the LEDs under the top row of round buttons
        Parameters:
        controlIx - A number between 0 and 7 (0 is the left-most control button on the top row).
        color - A color to set the control button.
